meanings.definition: The practice of strictness or severity in principles or conduct.
meanings.sent1: Her rigorisms in following the school rules made her a model student.
meanings.sent2: The company's rigorisms in quality control ensured consistent product excellence.
meanings.sent3: His rigorisms in always wearing matching socks became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The rigorisms of the ancient samurai code were as unyielding as steel.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's rigorisms in grading assignments were known to all students.

meanings.definition: A strict adherence to a particular set of rules or standards.
meanings.sent1: The team's rigorisms in following the game plan led to their victory.
meanings.sent2: The artist's rigorisms in technique resulted in breathtaking masterpieces.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's rigorisms in baking cookies always produced the perfect batch.
meanings.sent4: The rigorisms of the legal system can sometimes feel overwhelming to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The chef's rigorisms in using fresh ingredients elevated the flavors of the dish.
